import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react' import '../../cssHelper/helper.css' import './Update.css' import { useParams } from 'react-router-dom'; function Update() { let { id } = useParams(); const [product, setProduct] = useState([]) const [newDetails, setNewDetails] = useState([ { name: '', price: '', quality: '', brand: '', color: '', size: '', description: '', quality: '', weight: '', category: '' } ]); const getItem = async (itemId) => { try { const response = await fetch(`http://localhost:4000/product/${itemId}`, { method: 'GET', headers: { Accept: 'application/json', 'Content-Type': 'application/json', }, }); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error(`HTTP error! Status: ${response.status}`); } const data = await response.json(); console.log(data); setProduct(data) } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching item:', error); } }; useEffect(() => { getItem(id); }, []) const handleUpdate = (e) => { setNewDetails({ ...newDetails, [e.target.name]: e.target.value, [e.target.price]: e.target.value, [e.target.quality]: e.target.value, [e.target.brand]: e.target.value, [e.target.color]: e.target.value, [e.target.size]: e.target.value, [e.target.description]: e.target.value, [e.target.quantity]: e.target.value, [e.target.weight]: e.target.value, [e.target.category]: e.target.value, }) } console.log(newDetails); return (
add
